event.title: was founded in the spring of 1871

data.event: Alma was founded in the spring of 1871 by a group of Union Pacific railroad laborers originally from Cheyenne, Wyoming.

event.title: was created by the Nebraska Legislature on June 3, 1871

data.event: Harlan County was created by the Nebraska Legislature on June 3, 1871, and Alma was made the county seat on July 3, 1871.

event.title: was made the county seat on July 3, 1871

data.event: Harlan County was created by the Nebraska Legislature on June 3, 1871, and Alma was made the county seat on July 3, 1871.
A dispute among the original settlers led to a dissolution of the town, but it was re-organized in 1874.
On January 13, 1880, the Burlington Railroad reached Alma, providing a significant boost for local commerce and industry.

event.title: 1887, the Kansas City and Omaha Railroad also reached

data.event: In 1887, the Kansas City and Omaha Railroad also reached Alma.
Telephone service reached Alma in June 1899.

event.title: arrived with a steam power plant in 1906

data.event: Electricity arrived with a steam power plant in 1906 and water service followed in 1907.
Electricity arrived with a steam power plant in 1906 and water service followed in 1907.
